Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begins the vocabulary of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my sons, I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, in order to fulfill its purpose and due to its expositions and declarations, I believe that I have completed this treatise, which is part of surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The surgery of the mother is prohibited in our region and time, until recently, when the science of it was revealed, and its evidence is now established; and no one practices it except a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which were most harmful and led to errors and doubts until the understanding of it was closed and its force was prolonged and its art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I believe that I have lived according to the order of this treatise in the second way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and because it comes with the forms of the tools of the cautery and of the other instruments of the work, as well as for addition to the declaration, and for its preparation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	In ancient times, the cause for why an artist was not skilled in their own hand was because the art of medicine is long, and it is necessary to exercise that skill in the science of anatomy, which Gallus discovered before knowing the importance of the members and the forms of those, and the conjunction and separation of them; and having knowledge of the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their number, and their breadth; and of the pulsating veins and quiet vessels, and the locations of their origin.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason, Hippocrates said that one name is not enough, but in the work, it is smaller, and more so in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	Because we have already mentioned that one in the introduction of this book; for those who do not know what we have said about anatomy, will not avoid falling into error by which many men have died, as I have seen too many of those, because they are formed in this science and get their knowledge from that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	When a doctor was called to see a woman who had developed an abscess of the neck, and had also injured some arteries in the neck causing great blood loss, resulting in the woman dying among her companions.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And another doctor saw a man who had been stabbed with a stone from a house that had been built, and the stone was large, and it came to him and removed that stone from his body through a small incision, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And he had already been called to extract that, and saw that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient, it was known that she would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And another doctor took the salary of a duke from our land for surgery, and went to an experienced blacksmith who was skilled in setting bones; and because of his ignorance, the doctor removed the fracture, on the plate, with pins and nails with strong structure, and did not allow the bone to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then gradually remove the bandage according to his wishes, and then remove the dressing, and then the leech for several days and nights, and command that we remove the bandage; and this is when the wound and the foot become infected, and reach a dangerous state.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And then apply it to him, and prepare to remove the bandage, and thus achieve peace and relieve his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if corruption was already confirmed in the member, so that it could not be controlled, and did not cease to spread the corruption in the member until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And then another doctor who punctured an abscess and made it ulcerated after several days, until the fire magnified the malice of it to the Lord of it.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of which is that the cranium is pure of melancholic humor, so that it does not reach the patient with all the iron, but rather that the member which suffers be held from all.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	For this reason, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation should be divided into two parts: one in the operation that is associated with health, and the other in the work that is performed in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	I have already existed in this place where the operation is performed, where there is error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard that and lay down that one, so that the people do not approach to speak to you and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your weapons with solicitude and protection of God, and your patients with success and stability.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way for the grace of God to lead to salvation and praiseworthy succession, and lay down those terrible diseases of difficult healing, and let your weapons be in that which makes you fear, so that your situation in your faith and in your name does not escape from you: because more remains to your glory, and more in the world and more behind your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	In some of its symptoms, it causes swelling in certain parts of the body.
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not heal the patient incorrectly, because misguided doctors may not recognize it.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already dedicated this book according to three titles.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The beginning of the division of the book, and the first of the first section.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered by the foot, in the forms of instruments and in the irons of cautery, and of what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second section.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on dryness and puncture, and on ventosas, and on plagues, and on the extraction of sage and similar things to those, all chapter ordered by the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third section.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and on dislocation, and on the cure of tortion and similar things to those; chapter ordered by the foot, and by the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of sharp cautery and sharp medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that chapter begins the treatise on all the free.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	That you know the quality of those handles of that cautery and of its sheaths, and in what condition it is prohibited to use cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech about the quality of the handle of cautery and its sheath is a long and elaborate and subtle for knowledge, and secretly hidden; and from there they have spoken much about secrets, and because of it they have disagreed, and to me it has been a short part of their speeches, I am afraid of length.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery compares to the whole complete condition universally, which is matter or its matter, except for two conditions, which are conditions of the tail, which is matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the condition of the tail and dry matter, they disagree; because one said that cautery is suitable for that, and the others said the opposite of that, that cautery is not convenient in illness which is due to quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that illness tail and dry matter that is caut and dry be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And tell that person who says the opposite of that, that cauterization is greatly beneficial in all kinds of illness and dryness that is seen in the bodies of men, because when you compare the bodies of men to the humidity of fire, the bodies of men are wet.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the word of that person, that I have experienced this myself several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But I do not know that there is someone who has experienced this already and has been trained in the capital of cauterization through previous exercise, and has known the diversity of the appearance of men and the disposition of their illnesses, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the span of time for those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other appearances, you should not be afraid, and especially in illnesses that are wet and humid, because all doctors have agreed on those, and they do not disagree in the benefit of cauterization in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And you should know, children, that the secret of healing by fire and the goodness of it, is that cauterization is simple, because the action of it only reaches the member that is cauterized and not to the other member that is adjusted with it, unless it causes a small harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	May the action of medicine burn through to that part of the body which is affected by it, and it often brings relief to the sick member and is often used for difficult healing and often causes pain.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	May the fire, due to its greatness and goodness of substance, not do this, but rather, it is known by us through experiment and long experience in the study of the art on the truth of causes; and for this reason you are excused from the length of the sermon. And if not, then it would not be understood at all in this pause to you secretly hidden away with the fire, and the quality of the operation of which in the bodies and its expulsion by which it expels evils, is a philosophical demonstrative speech, which would be sharpened in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, my sons, that they should not forget the time in which it is convenient to make a cautery and they should wait for the best time of primeval morning.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the damage caused by time is submerged in the jubilant joy of which is thrown with the cautery, and more so if the cautery is for pain or necessary painful ones, quickly and forcefully, the ones that do not suffer delay because it is feared of those that come malicious, which is greater than small damage entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And do not catch in your feet, or, sons, that is only appreciated by the common people and foolish doctors, because that illness that is cured with cauterization is not always effective for a long time, and they stop that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not that they seek for that, because cauterization is only a matter of medicine which alters the appearance and dries out the moisture which is the cause of the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But it is often used for cauterization above medicine for the sake of its value and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that its illness returns in some time of the time, according to the appearance of the patient and the location of its illness, and its virtue, and that which is prepared in the body of the patient from the aggregation of superfluities in it, and that which is obtained by it in the acquisition of foods and similar causes; but the illness in which cauterization is administered is a subtle illness of a few members of superfluities and moisture, like a tooth cautery for pain and similar to that, possible is that in it does not return that pain, but that which is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And more commonly, people believe that the pointed cautery is the last resort of medicine, and they think that there is no cure that can be achieved with medicine or any other cause before using the pointed cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is the opposite of that; and they understand that the pointed cautery is the last resort of medicine only when administering methods of treatment in some diseases, and those medicines do not work, and at the end of the cause, they administer homeopathy, and it works for that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here, people believe that the pointed cautery is the last resort of medicine, but they understand it in a different way than what I understand as a common person and too many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that gold is better than iron for cauterizing, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the superiority of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location of cauterizing does not matter, because it is not absolutely true, for I have seen some people who are very good and others who are not, and cauterizing with gold is better than with iron, but rather when you do cauterizing with fire and gold, it is not up to your declaration, because it depends on the quantity that you want to use, and because it prepares to receive the heat of the gold, and if you adjust over the fire, the gold melts for the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for that, a pointed cautery of iron is made lighter and more conveniently and more directly to the direction of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter in the second chapter of the cautery, and have ordered those between the feet, so that the muleteer asks him what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for head pain caused by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery is caused by moisture and cold on the most common accident of which these causes are the cause of many traumatic fluxes, called crisis, from the head to the parts of the arms and legs fluent, and many sleep, and of tooth pain and the gums, and universally of all evil that comes from cold, such as paralysis, hardness and apoplexy, and similarities in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first commands the patient to be evacuated with a laxative medicine for the head, for three or four nights, according to the virtue of the patient and his age and his custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command the one who is shaving his own head to do so between your hands on a chair that you have placed, and place your hands over his chest to prevent him from falling.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the back of your hand on the shaving razor near the nose between his fingers.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, since the place you mentioned on your body has been reached, sign that location and then apply the pointed cautery made of olive oil, which is in this form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the location well and apply it gently, so that it does not hurt too much at once, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then raise your hand slightly and look at the location, and if you see that some amount of bone has been exposed, as much as the amount of grain, then raise your hand, and if it does not return, place your hand on that iron, or another one, if it is cooled, before it is seen from the bone what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small piece of salt and dissolve it on the location and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your hand on the wound that has been opened in the border and leave that over the entrance where the skin of the fire should be destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the four-pharmacon ointment into the wound to make it heal.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that as long as the plague is open, the more it gets better and more useful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they say that the cord should be cauterized inside the bone, and it should be held with the cauterizer until some part of the bone is burned.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove that which has been stuck to the bone, and then heal it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they say that the cauterizer should reach the back, until it reaches the strong part of the bone where the bone breaks, and this is the way to puncture the little heel:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimate that from that wound the vapors of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then healed until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cautery used in all men, except on those who are second in line due to fear; and if that one leaves, then it is better for the sake of his health when it is, because the head is revealed by the solution of continuity of which he has with the other members, and more so when the head of the patient is of naturally fragile nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cautery is more saving and better for me; and from that one, and from the other work, it is for the sake of his health.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When the whole head is affected by chronic and long-lasting pain, and this is prolonged in the patient, and uses of garlic and of charcoal and of capipurges and of ointments and of bandages and of sweats and of gallipots and of similars, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery which they have and do not know how to apply to it again from those causes, then consider that if the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and not fragile and atrophied, then that cautery applies another one after that one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that on the surface of his head with a pointed cautery where the skin is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the skin and expose the bone to the extent that we have found it, and cauterize that with a pointed cautery in the part behind the head where it is called the mastoid process, — and that is the place where the pillow is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And let your hand rest there, and do not expose the bone, because the patient will suffer great pain from that, different from the pain of all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say that this cauterization is in that place, because it is the cautery that is used to cauterize the tips of the head and the back of the head, which is a more subtle cauterization than the one that is used to cauterize the middle part of the head; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the ancient non-anterior cauterization.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When the pain is severe in the part of the head, or it penetrates to the eye, let the doctor administer the remedies that make the head better, and administer the other cure, which I have mentioned in the treatises on illnesses; and if none of these help, then the cauterization is done in two ways: either with a sharp cautery or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May the pointed cautery be used as you take a lancet and prick that area and apply a bandage to its extremities to stop the bleeding.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then incise the location of the pain in the temple with a blade that is inserted into the place where it is located, until it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then apply pressure over the stopped bleeding with a bandage that is tightly compressed, and leave it for three hours; and then remove the lancet, and let the wound heal for two or three days, and then apply a poultice on the affected area until the place stops bleeding.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that one until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do that with some burning remedies that I have written in the other treatise on burning remedies.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cauterization be done in this way: light the cautery with the following method:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a "claw hammer" because its head has the form of a carnation in which there is some curvature, and at the middle part of it is a small projection.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place your hand on the location of the pain, and retrieve your hand - so that the wound is not stuck with the bandage that has been left - and turn the small iron at high speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of blood that is stuck due to the type of cloth is such that it covers most of the patient, and lift your hand to prevent the artery from being stuck with the bandage that has been left, so that there is no bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a salted water dressing on that location, and leave it for three days; and then apply a wet dressing, and then heal with an ointment as soon as it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cauterize the end of the knife according to the cautery, and be careful not to cut the artery in this situation properly.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the ancient cautery of the emigration.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an emigration with the remedy we have mentioned in the previous cure, and the remedy we have mentioned in the divisions of diseases, and if you do not improve the cure, and see that the disease does not respond to the first cauterization with medicine or the cauterization with fire, then cover the cauterization of the knife before it becomes bright, so that it means over the location of the pain with a long line of the same length as the one you have used; and place your hand firmly between the incision and the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuity of the mandible, which is often damaged during mastication, and that the jaw not be held too tightly and the nerves that may be affected, and that nothing happens.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the guard and care of the flow of blood from an artery that is abscised, which in the abscission of which there is fear, and more so for those who do not know what to do and are not studious; and leave the operation until the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you should remember the rule of the flow of blood from an artery according to your method, in its own place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this evil that does not allow this cautery and sees the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize that in the middle location of the head as we have reported, and cure the wound before it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you see, administer the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter of stretching of an artery having two points, and this cauterization is better and more suitable.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of gout pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the big toe occurs due to cold humors and is treated with laxatives and the other treatment mentioned in the previous section, but the pain does not disappear, then use the cautery without making points, and this is the one that has no name, of which the following is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then use the pointed cautery, and bring it close to the flame, and place it around the entire big toe as if it were rotating, or in the circle of each joint if the pain is in each one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	While applying the cautery to the edge of the big toe, gently press it into the place where it hurts.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery touches all the big toe, and it is painful, then quickly treat the affected areas before they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture that is cured and treated with cauterization is only of the specific kinds that come from inflammation, as we have mentioned in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid the use of a dry or spasm-inducing cautery on the sensitive area.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that area of turmoil with jelly, purgatives, and worm medicine, and do not compare your treatment, then you should cauterize the patient with three cautery points: the first at the end of the golden hair, the second a little below their temple, and the third at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your hand on the opposite side of the affected area, as softening only occurs in the healthy part.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cautery application is that you cauterize that area with the cautery at the end of the golden hair, a little above the corner of the cap, and on the temple, the longest one being second to the length of the previously mentioned point, and place your hand inside before the quantity of the main part of the coda is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is specific to the knife, the shape of which is given in the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	May it be, however, that there is also a more subtle cause in the abundance of excess grease.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then care for the area with the procedure until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of the ancient cautery for apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When ancient apoplexy is treated with the procedure we have mentioned and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize that area with four cauteries: on all parts of the head; and with a cauterizer at the middle of the head, as we have mentioned; and with a cauterizer in the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The method of the cauterizer is done as it is mentioned above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and more behind; and then care for the area with the procedure.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of the cautery for forgetfulness caused by flatulence.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Gave the patient large and tasteful pills at the beginning of the treatment.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then remove the entire cap from the patient and place it on the described plaster in the treatise of plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And place some cautery, which is a sign of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do this second according to the method that has already been mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if those methods are successful; and if not, then make three cauterizations on the back part of his head, which should be placed from the most superior part of the head towards the most inferior part of the head.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the largest part of the above between each cauterization, and then cure the cauterized area with the method that is used.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you feel additional pain and the patient is tolerating it, then make the cauterization in the middle location; and if you feel greater pain, then cauterize that one on both feet.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then cure it until it is healed; and the cauterization should be made according to the form given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cautery of the perineum and softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Having already processed in the softening of the head and neck, and with that which we have said; then shave the patient's head, and then apply the pointed cautery at the middle of the head, and apply the cautery over all the joints of the head, and apply the cautery on the back part of it, and three cautery on the spines of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the patient's condition of softening of the body, and if the patient tolerates three cautery, and if the condition is strong, then apply four cautery over the spines of the back, and afterwards apply the cautery inside where the tail of the patient comes out, and raise the hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then care for that until it is healed, and this cautery should be made with olive oil.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cautery of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized, but that epilepsy is by flexibility.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore, it is necessary to modify the patient's brain at the beginning of their illness and on the other side, the cure that we have said in the division when the patient is large and tolerates the exception of the medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not suffer the medicines, then give them gourds and mustard plasters to the servant who modifies, giving them this for several days, good benefit of the foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize that with a cauterizer at the middle of the back of the head according to the previous method, and with another cauterizer in the occiput of them, and over each corner of the head cauterize.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerates, then cauterize that with cauterizers which I have said, having paralysis and softening of the body over the spines of the neck and the spines of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And if it is a cauterizer as it has been said before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then place cauterizers gently according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of Cautery for Melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted moisture and flatulent gas, then cautery is applied to those parts which we have mentioned in the book.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive and tends towards melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give him to drink that which cleanses his brain according to the water that has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the head of the patient, and make a small incision decently on the top of his head over the circle, and place your hand on that spot.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be laid down, and held from all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then place a liniment; and it is worthy of being boiled with ancient wool fat.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And scald that over the fire for warming, prepared by measure, which the patient says is sufficient when it is enough in him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then apply that in the middle spot of his head over the circle, and let it enter him until it is dissolved.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And apply that to the patient every week for the entire week until they are healed; or if you wish, make small points with a cautery according to the most appropriate part of the body, but always hold the hand with a moistened cotton swab: this is a special type of cautery that hydrates the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And place your hand on that swollen area in the form of a border or in grayish-white color.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	About the application of descending water cautery on the belly.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared to you that the beginning of water application on the belly by means of syringes, as I have mentioned in the division, then begin and give the patient that which will cleanse the head of the body, and keep that from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make that which is washed in hot water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And command the patient to shave their own head, and make points with a cautery in the middle of the head; and then make points with two cauteries on two temples if it is the beginning of water application in two bellies, or on one side if it is the beginning of water application in one belly.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Incision with the cautery all the veins and arteries that are behind the neck; and those in that area on the side of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flow when it is cauterized; and if you see blood flow from there, stop it with some medicine, which is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And if you find knowledge of the kind that is in the extraction of arteries and the removal of those and caution about blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some veins are cauterized in the neck behind two bones and two cautery recently produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of ancient lacrimals.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the lacrimals of the forehead are very old and through the veins and arteries that are in that place clearly and it is verified that this is superfluous, then cauterize that with the cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter on the beginning of water accumulation in the forehead, and the cautery in the middle of the head and two cautery in the neck behind two temples, and two cautery in the neck behind two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if it is necessary to make an incision, then cauterize that area in the entire length of the neck on the tip of the upper eyelid with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of bad odor from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that person with the method we mentioned in the division and have not yet completed your treatment, then prepare and give the patient three doses of bread; and remove their cap, and cauterize the area with a thinner or thicker cautery, depending on the situation.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that area with a small needle between the two upper eyelids, under the eyebrows.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that area.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the needle cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cauterization for the softening of the eyelids.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a moon-shaped cautery; and this is its form.
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, using a small pointed cautery, make points on the two upper eyelids in all parts, and extend them from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the size of the upper eyelid.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too much on the cautery, but according to the quantity that the sticky part of the eyelid is attached.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Concerning the cautery of the eyelid when the hairs become converted into the parts inside and poke the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eyelid become converted into the parts inside and poke the eye, cautery is done in those places according to two methods, either by burning or by medical means.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If the cautery is done with fire, command the patient to hold those hairs that are similar to those that are shaved, until they are prolonged and equal; and if it pokes his eye, then strengthen the eyelids of that eye with a bandage so that it does not become infected until the hairs have grown.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore, when they are born and grown, pause the patient's head on your shoulder, and then place your hand over their eyelids with a second tent, which should be in the shape of a fan of mercury, and the beginning of the tent near their ears.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place a cool cloth or moistened cotton on their eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then remove the cautery that has this shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize the shape that was placed, little by little, in waves, until the surface of the eyeball, which is like a fan of mercury, is completely burned.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And to ensure the healing of the eye work, you should see that the eyelid is already contracted and the ears of the eye are raised for the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave it on that for three days, and then place the cloth over it until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then take care to remove that which is unhealthy until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	However, if it returns through the eyes due to some cause and the eyelid becomes softened, then do so with another pointed cautery on that spot as you had done previously.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	However, if the eyes are in the eyelid, then cauterize that which is inside and raised to its natural place and equalized so that the eyes do not push it out.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	However, if the pointed cautery is not available, command the patient to look at the eyes while they are prolonged and equalized, and then make a shape of paper or cloth in the form of a funnel.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take some known wool and live worms, and mix those causes with beeswax, and make that into a poultice so that it is not scattered; and then spread that over the paper which is made as mentioned above, and place that on one of the eyelids; and place the other eyelid on a flat surface in a bowl of water, and let the head of the patient be in an upright position.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Pause the medicine over the patient and press it gently into them so that the patient does not feel the bite of the medicine, which is like a burning fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, as the patient persists with the biting pain, press the medicine into them again and give it to them; once the pain ceases, remove the medicine and wash the affected area with clean water; then consider whether the eyelid has already been raised as if it were washed from the constraint of fire or incision, for that is well; and if not, return to the previous step of the medicine on the place where the medicine has not yet pressed in and does not become damaged before your operation is completed and is contrary to the affected area.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then pause over the patient's side near the border until the code of the adhesion is eradicated, and then cure that with the ointment or another remedy until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to guard your operation that you keep the medicine from falling out of the affected area, and if the eyelid approaches too quickly and some cause of the hairs pushing into the affected area, then repeat your medicine on that place where the eyelid is softened, and usually as you did at the beginning, and continue until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of the herb of myrtle.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the feet of men are varied according to their size and shape, so you make your adjustment accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	Do not obstruct the straight path to that which is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery of a fistula that is in the lacrimal duct of the foot.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula of this kind, do not follow the method we have described in the sections on diseases, but rather cauterize it in this way: command the patient to tilt their head towards you, and hold their head at an angle between your hands in such a way that it is not too high or too low.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a cotton pad soaked in alcohol or a mucilage of poppy seeds on the foot of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cautery of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is straight or shaped like a cane or penis of the vulva, at one end of which the pointed cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see, it should penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to draw out, use a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But the one that is straight is better for the intended purpose.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press the fistula if it is opened, and drain out the pus and dry it up.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, then open it and extract the pus from there.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place your hand over the cautery which is hot, and hold it away from the patient's face and the part of the nose, so that your hand or the patient is not burned, and then place the cautery on the gray matter of the brain and corrupt it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of the treatment the cautery goes through the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary; and leave that there for three days, and then place your hand over that and around the area until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If they have been suffering for several days and have not healed, then pause the sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is discovered and scraped according to what is appropriate in its own chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing the fistula which was first described as follows: enter the place of the fistula and make that, and then place your hand in that fissure which is the shape of the wound; and put on that amount of one ounce of lead; and with your hand hold it well for retention, and do not let the patient be burned by the lead so that it does not reach the bottom of that; and cover that you place over the patient's wound with albumen of egg or water, where the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it by wonderful cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by what we have said about cauterization and cure, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to administer a nasal douche and reduce the fistula to the nose according to its own location when it comes.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cautery of the wound in the foot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Women often get tears in their labia, and especially in those of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those tears with the cautery that we have mentioned in divisions and do not apply your treatment, then use the small pointed cautery of this form:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its hollow is according to the thinness of a spoon.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that instrument carefully into those tears until the cautery reaches the edge of the tears.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with the cautery until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cautery of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the uvula or on the palate or in the gums, an abscess forms and becomes hard, and then it is broken, and then it becomes old, and then it is hard again, and a fistula forms, and then you treat it and do not apply your treatment, then use the cautery according to the quantity that has been reabsorbed in the fistula, and then put that hot into the mouth of the fistula, and then place your hand inside until the hot iron reaches the edge of it, and then make a small incision or two; and then treat it with the cautery that we have mentioned for treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the sinus is removed and healed, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to discover the location and treat the corrupted bone according to what comes in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of the extraction of teeth and the melting of the jaws.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the jaws are softened by moisture and the teeth are loose, then pause the patient's head on your thigh, and place the hot cautery in the shape that will be used, holding the cup over the tooth and inserting it into the cavity of the cautery burning vigorously, until the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and repeat the cautery several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient closes their mouth with salt water and holds it for an hour, as the loose tooth is closed, the softened jaw is strengthened, and the corrupted moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cautery for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by coldness, or there is frost or worms in it, and the medicine does not provide relief, then cautery can be used in two ways: with a cautery made of cow's horn, or with a cauterizing iron.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	The cautery made of cow's horn is to take a piece of cow's horn and melt it in the fire, then take a cotton cloth and wrap it around the end of the probe, and quickly insert that into the tooth that hurts, pausing it over the painful tooth until it is frostbitten.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times until the power of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse wool or cotton in the horn below, and place that over the painful tooth, and place that over the ignited iron until the iron reaches the end of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	When using the pointed cautery to cauterize, you wait for the right moment when it is hot enough, and if there is any rust on it or if the heat does not reach the patient's mouth, then do not use it.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the pointed cautery in the shape it will take, and place that on the tooth, and your hand over it until the cautery is extinguished; and do this several times so that the pain remains or on that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And cover that the patient closes his own mouth with good border and holds it for an hour, and then scrape it off; this is the shape of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize where you can reach with your hand.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the needle:

When hernias are flexible and affected by humors and do not obey digestion by medicines and you want to make them more firm, then ignite the cautery in the shape that is this following, having two extremities so that the smoke from the cautery can pass through the other extremity, and place that on the abscess a few times, and if it needs it, until the point of the cautery reaches the center of the abscess.

Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of the cauterization of a wart on the nose and its contraction.

Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	Of the cauterization of the nipple, which is the help of the helper.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz. E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then light the cautery which has two heads; and this is the shape of it:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the codex until it penetrates into the other side; and the figure of the cauterization will come from four heads of cautery.
