And you should know that when blood flows from the artery, it is not possible to close the wound in those places, and especially when the artery is large, there are four ways: either use a cauterizer as mentioned above, or extract it when it is not extracted, because when the extremities of the veins are burned and the wound is closed, it should be tied with a strong thread or bandage, or placed on medicines that have the virtue of closing the wound; and they should be strengthened by a cushion or compression.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	May the one who administers a proper restriction of his clothing and a proper bandage or by positioning causes and similar ones, does not compare but burns.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If that happens to anyone and is not the doctor present or medicine, then open a small incision on the indicated part of that vein as we have said, and understand that the skin should not be removed from the affected part of the wound, and over the rib cage it should not remain; and above the ribcage, sprinkle with cold water until the skin is congealed and swollen; and cover in case of cauterization or medical necessity.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incisions and punctures and bleeding and phlebotomy and wounds and their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter that all illnesses in which cauterization with fire is appropriate and medicine burns, and the occasions and causes of them, and the instruments in which they are necessary, and the forms of the cautery; and we have ordered the chapters of the sub-headings of the head down to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter to treat this matter in such a way that it may be helpful to those who seek such knowledge, regarding what has been asked.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And since I have begun that, child, you should know that in this chapter we will discuss what is described in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And since it is important for you to know that in the operation described in this chapter, which involves the removal of matter, the same precautions apply as in the aspiration of the vein or incision over the abscess or extraction of the stone or incision of the stone.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all these are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in the worst cases, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that you should not perform this operation on yourself, for some of these procedures require the skills of a doctor to treat certain diseases.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And some of them may be driven to their disease and die from it, and they suffer greatly because of the severity of their disease, and the length of their illness, and the fear of death that accompanies it.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those who give you such advice, you should expect healing and their illness is harmful.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore do not trust in anyone who comes to you with such a method; and your caution should be greater than what is customary, and your rapacity; and do not presume any cause about this unless you have certain knowledge that it works for you, and to which successful succession brings praise.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the treatment of all your illnesses prediction and indication of him to whom you are converted for salvation, because in that one is with you assistance on acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O children, God bless you with His understanding and does not lead you astray and protect you, because that is in His hands.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter to be distinguished by chapters following the second chapter of cauteries, of the cure of the head between the feet, so that it is for you rejoicing in that which you ask about and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	Chapter one.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the cure of gout, which is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	You should know that this disease affects children during childhood and when the newborn opens his head, he is susceptible to it.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	Sometimes it occurs due to an unknown cause.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I have never seen this disease in adults; and to all those who I have seen with it, death has followed, and for that reason, I believe it is a work of the devil in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	I have seen a child whose head was full of water, and his head was always like that until he could not put his hand on it due to the greatness of his head, and more than the humidity increased until he died by fire.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity is added between the skin and the bone, or it is added under the bone over the joint.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	If the humidity is between the skin and the bone and the abscess is small, then you should make an incision in the middle of the child's head at the top, and the length of the incision should be two nights until the humidity flows out, and this is the shape of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And if the humidity is increased and the abscess is larger, then here are two incisions according to this method:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity goes to the bone, it is similar to that you see the junctions of the head exposed from all parts and the water is squeezed out when you press it to the mouth and not to your hand.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	So that you cut in the middle of the head with three incisions according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And remove all the humidity from the incision; and apply compresses with cloths and feathers; and apply ointment of honey and oil every five days, and remove the scab and cure the wound with tests and ointments, and cover the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food with little humidity until that member is comfortable and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision, which you consider according to the size of the abscess and the collection of water, that sometimes it is more in the occipital region, or in the front part, or on the right side, or on the left; and then pay attention to the incision where the abscess appears and the collection of water, and do it as best possible.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not incise the artery and engage it in flow, as this could lead to death of the patient due to loss of fluid and removal of moisture.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter 2.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries that are close to the ears, called temporal arteries.
Capitol segon.	Chapter 2.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When a catarrh or swelling occurs in the thighs or chest, and it is confirmed that this is the case, and you do not confuse it with other treatments, then this treatment would be in the incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore, when you want to incise those that the patient's head has, and you approach the location with dry cloth to prevent the arteries from appearing, and you strengthen the collar of the patient with some cloth; and you consider where the vein is; and the locations of each above the locations that are close to the ears, and they are hidden in only a few people.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then approach the arch of the foot with a probe, and then insert each one into the space of each part, entering it through the bone, and that is because of the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the probe through the artery and then cut it at the points above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And if the length of the incision is two such adjustments, then when a vein is incised, the blood flows out, which is often frequent.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the arch does not appear at the surface, then measure the amount of space from three such adjustments, and then approach the probe, and enter it through the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And that amount of blood that flows out is about one ounce, and it does not flow out more or less, and all of this depends on the quantity that appears from the virtue of the patient and the replacement of the arch of the foot.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the cause, and if there is some reason for the abscess on the bone, then insert it through that so that it does not become an abscess carefully.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then apply strength to the wound with feathers and cloth from linen, and then care for that with ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of stones that are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When an ancient or sharp stone, due to humid and bad conditions in the temples, or a very hard and similar stone, and it is treated with medical methods and does not respond, then we have shown extraction of stones from the temples, or cauterization of those as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of operation and extraction of those is that the patient raises the eyelids; and understand the stone that is apparent in the temple where it is shown by its own pole, and it is hidden only in a few people due to force of scratching.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden, then the back of the patient's hand should be strengthened with some cloth; and then scratch the area with a rough cloth or evaporate the area with hot water until the stone appears clearly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And here is the shape of this spoon:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then, with the help of a hook that facilitates its entry into the acetabulum; and then, extract it from the bone and remove the pieces above it until you remove the hook from the bone and discover the pieces of the tendons that were left there, from all parts.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is thin, then wrap it with a thread at the end of the needle, and then cut one piece according to the amount by which its ends were elongated and contracted, and do not cut too much, because if it is not cut, the blood will not stop flowing.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then remove the blood from the wound with a cloth or gauze.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the acetabulum is large, then cover it with two pieces of double-strength gauze or cord that is long enough to prevent putrefaction and promote the consolidation of the wound and stop the flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then cut away the excess that is between two layers; and do this at that time or another time.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	If you wish, cauterize that part with the pointed cautery until it reaches the area where the edges of it are located, and it will remain in place like that of a wound dressing.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	It is better to do this if the patient has fever or a scalded complexion; because the cautery is one of those causes that help to end moisture, and therefore it is better in such cases.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And cover the extraction of the arches that have collapsed in the old wound, and place them on clean cotton properly made, and then apply dry medicines to heal the flesh and warm compresses until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And while you are performing another procedure to stop the flow of pus from the arch, at that time you should press or cauterize that pus, or place something over the wound, and strengthen your hand until it is pressed.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of those causes are present, then place your hand over the wound until the pus is congealed, and apply cold water to the area with great coldness until the pain subsides, and then strengthen it as needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And the thing that is more painful in extraction of archery is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two points, so that you have sensed both locations with tent, and pause as needed, mot ignitz, until they reach the bone and incise the vein in two places, so that that which is between the extremities of it, because they are not solidified from all this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the sharpness of the two points is as follows.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But if the sharpness of two points is better than one, because if they are as sharp as two points approaching each other, and do not incise the flesh at speed.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, in those cases where there is some thickness, the heat of the fire should be kept in those and the flesh should be incised more painfully.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all works and less painful.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the space between the two points is the thickness of the aforementioned.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the treatment of bodies affected by sharp and acidic humors from the wounds.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the acidic humors are in the body, and they are in the veins on the top of the head, and there is no cause for healing in that area of medicine, and the face of the patient becomes wrinkled and feels like it is walking with ants, and the wounds from those are extended, humidified as if their fur is known, and their feathers are scalded by the acidity of the tears, the ancient methods in the cure of those of this operation, and name that cure a spasm.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to raise the hairs on his forehead, and then insert three incisions equally spaced along the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the incision is two times: the first incision should be equally spaced along the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second along the length of a little bit less than the movement of the eyelids which are in the lacrimal, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And watch out for the beginning of the arches, which are in two layers, and extend your hand from the continuation of the jaws to the mandibles.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space between each beginning is three times as much, adjust it.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a sponge or dry cloths at hand, use them to remove the wetness from the wound.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula between two sharp edges, of which this is the shape of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the part of the temples to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape away all the membrane that is between two incisions above the pericardium, which is over the bone, and then do so from the incision that moves towards the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then spread this spatula and insert another instrument into the first incision, which is called a scalpel, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And place your hand on the sharp side of that scalpel against the flesh attached to the membrane, and on the other side of the bone, and push it into that until it reaches the second incision, and cut away all those vessels that descend from the head to the feet.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	While continuing the incision at this point of the codex, and then make that in the median fissure between the other fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And when an equal quantity of blood has been drawn, express the veins of the feet by constriction.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then place your hand on each fissure of the old man's calf, and place your hand on those wounds that are open and bleeding and open, and make sure they do not become a pus-filled abscess.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, remove the bandage and administer a large amount of warm water or tea, and then cure that with an ointment made from basil icon or rose-scented oil and other ingredients until the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the cure of gout by cauterization and the descents of the humors from the parts mentioned in the chapter.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When a vein is cauterized and continues, and the veins of the patient become weak and their eyelids are ulcerated and they lose their hair, and in the beginning of the chapter there is sharp pain and subsequent exhaustion, then you should know that the materials and cauterization do not come from any but certain veins of the parts mentioned in the chapter.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for those is this: command the patient to turn their face, and then make a small incision on the right side of the forehead, near the temple (and start the incision from the left temple towards the right temple; and it should go through the bone; and extend your hand under the temples which are bruised due to mastication), until it reaches the bone.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry out all the pus with a sponge or dry cloth, and then fill it between the two lips of the incision at the old wound or with the cloths of the patient.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then apply a poultice on top of the swollen parts to prevent abscess formation.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you see that the abscess has decreased, then rub the bone until it reaches the new flesh, and apply a dry dressing that makes new flesh, as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of collofania and mix them, and make it into a poultice and administer it on these wounds to promote new flesh growth.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the treatment of that which is found in the armpits.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All the cause that is found in the armpits is one of four species, either it is mineral stone or a similar cause to stone, such as iron and verdigris, or it is a plant cause such as celandine or fava, or it is a fluid cause such as water and vinegar and similar substances, or some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore when stone is found in the armpit or other similar cause to those causes that do not adjust or believe in the armpit, and pauses the armpit in the sunlight, and if you see the stone, then distills some cause of purple oil or saffron into that, and administer the extraction of it, and make the sneezing condition, and open the nostrils for the event of sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place some pieces of cloth or wool around the armpit, and extend the armpit to the parts above, because those movements are forgotten in these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	If it is not possible to extract it with your fingers, then administer extraction using the instrument called the epicucious subtle, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is not possible to extract it with the epicucious, then administer extraction using the sharp instrument of double use.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And if it is not possible to extract it with that, then make a thin needle of copper and insert the end of the needle into the ear trumpet and seal around the needle with wax and softened oil so that it is not pushed out but the needle.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract it with a strong attraction, as many troops have reported that we have found.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not possible to extract it in this way, then take some unripe or ripe fruit and place it on the edge of a spoon, and wrap that covered edge with a clean cloth.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the ear trumpet and facilitate it, and remove the ear trumpet from the moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And if all the causes that we have mentioned are not forgotten, then you should proceed to cut that part which was affected by abscess or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	The method of cutting that part is to first bandage the patient with the vein sephasica and then remove the bandage according to the method of the virtue of the patient, and then place that cushion between your hands and convert the golden thread to the parts above, and make a small incision in the edge of the golden thread where the grey matter of the patient is located.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the incision be of lunar shape until it reaches the bone, and when the bone is found, if you can use appropriate instruments, then make that incision at that time with speed, and cure that part before it is healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause is one of the grasses that we believe and is inflated, then administer the cure and extraction of it; but if it does not obey your command, then take a thin spatula according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer to that person the antidote of that poison which has fallen into their ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do that when you think that the person is already moistened by the vapor from their ear, and pause them in a comfortable position, and prop them up with pillows or subtle gestures, or with anything that has been mentioned so far, which is praised for its extraction.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	May the water that enters the ear canal be used as a sneeze conditioner at the beginning, and fill the patient's ear with old wool, and place it on the ear in which the water is, and if it is removed, it is good; otherwise, take many thin needles according to the length of the above, and heat them in the fire for a short time, and the patient should insert one of those needles into the tragus of their ear and strike the other needle on the needle inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	So do not stop that with the needle until all the water is removed.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And if the wound is open and you have a paper or cloth, put one end in the ear and extend the other end into the fire until it is burned to the maximum.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put another cord and do that many times until all the wound is opened, and remove that which is underneath as is said of the stone extraneous to the eye.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	In the extraction of beasts entering that ear, if it is a small one, use the same method and the same tool as we have said in the division; but if it is of great size, which causes pain to the side of the brain, then administer the extraction of it with great care and precision, and the cause of it is the most difficult of all the other causes that can occur in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	In the extraction of worms that generate in the ear, when you cure that which we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations and do not compare your treatment, then cover that you regulate the ear to the sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if some cause of worms appears here, then extract that small or sharp instrument, but if no cause appears, then take a narrow and wide needle of this form:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the thin end of the needle into the ear, according to the amount that the patient can bear; and then strongly pull out that which was inserted, and do this repeatedly until all the worms are removed.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if they do not obey your instructions, then you will open and close the circuit of the needle with beeswax as we have said; and then administer distillations that have been used in the past for treating worms, and look for this in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your emission is the one that you use to fund the oils in the ear with this instrument of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or copper, narrow, in which there is a small hole, and place it on top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so it should be done as they are in the cavity of the catheter here where it is necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the rag and wrap it around the end of the catheter decently, and then pour some oil or herbs, or whatever you want from these medicines into the catheter -- and that is in the earthenware --, and then insert the rag above and press it with your hand until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the catheter and the patient feels the oil dripping.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And that which is in the earthenware should already be heated with a small fire.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful that the liquid you will distill in the earthenware is not too cold, because the medicines of earthenware cannot bear that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the cure of the breaking of earthenware.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some people have had some broken earthenware from their bellies of those who were not perforated, and that has happened in some men, breaking of the earthenware in the middle of the earthenware by plague or by nothing at all in that; and this breaking sometimes happens in the front of the earthenware which does not know the excrement, and sometimes it happens in the parts in front.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And in the case where an injury occurs at the front of the body, and it is not understood, it is often difficult to treat.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in the case where the cause is understood, cover the patient's head with a cloth and observe that area.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if you see an outgrowth appearing, use this thin probe in the shape of an 'L':
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the end of it where the width is small has one sharp part and the other not, and the probe is two spans long so as not to scratch the head.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the outgrowth is made of flesh in the head or on the body, then use this thin and sharp instrument to cut it away quickly before it becomes fully formed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the outgrowth is on the front of the head, then use a thin and sharp needle to heat it slightly, and then place it on the flesh of the head.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And if the patient feels the outgrowth and finds it difficult to remove, due to its size, forcefully press it away with difficulty; and be careful not to injure the nerves of the head.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place a cloth of the second quantity of the wide tape that you have wrapped around the thigh; and do this for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the wound; or take any bandage and push it into boiling water and powder it over the wound according to the third, and use it; and if you see that the cloth has become infected, then remove it and replace it with another one that you have wrapped in a cerot that is made of oiled rosin, until the infection has passed; and then cure it within the time it takes for it to heal.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	If there is an outflow of pus, then immerse a cloth or towel in boiling water and place it over the wound, and use another remedy that restricts the flow of pus, which is mentioned in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the treatment of ectropion, which occurs in the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	When some humors occur at the pores of the bones, some are dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, you should hold those who are holding them or the cushion, and cut those who are on their ribs, and place your hand over the areas according to the trisectors.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	If there is pain from cold venous blood, then you should cauterize those who are on the surface with a fine cauterizer.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	The best cauterization is to incise and remove the dry humors when they return from the ribs; and when they are cauterized by fire, those ribs are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Cure for great pain that comes to the pores of the bones.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Humors occur in the pores of the bones due to some cause that resembles great pain in its strength and hardness, and is called great pain.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And there is an accumulation of thick humidity in the pore above and below.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation in them is to consider whether the greatness arises from that which appears under the eyelid and is moistened at all parts; and the cause of it is unknown.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then place an incision over that part under the eyelid and remove all parts easily that may cause it to escape, and suspend that one and cut it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	If you are not equipped with an incision under the eyelid and cannot penetrate the eyelid with a small incision, then it will not be noted in any case.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then adjust it with stitches; and cure that part until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, then it will not be harmful for that part where the oil of it restores that and encases it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the greatness declines to the parts within the eyelid, then remove the eyelid and suspend the greatness with an incision, or another that you indicate of incision, and press all parts, and if the eyelid is elongated by the incision, then it will not be noted in any case.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And at the beginning, wash the wound with salted water; and treat the area with what is inside that will heal it.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the treatment of the eyelid above the wound.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axcirnath is gray matter that is produced in the tunics of the eyelid above, and especially in children, aggravates wounds of those and causes their catarrh the most; and they cannot look at the clarity of the sun because tears gather on those.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you see those people always talking with their mouths open; and on their mouths open while sleeping; and those have their eyelids under their eyebrows, which are already covered with inflammation, and imminent appearance of infection is in the eye; and when you press the area with the fingers, you push infection into those.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And some method of operation is in that which the patient pauses their head on the chin, and place a cloth under them and on top of them make a circle, and according to the amount that contains all parts of the body, and place that over that and press with the fingers of both hands all around so that infection is added in the middle of the circle, and then put a sponge in the middle of that humidity and insert it into the opening for the latitude, and the opening should not be larger than the opening that is made in flap surgery.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	May you cut the cord completely until you reach the umbilicus, where in most cases, the umbilicus is severed according to the form of a white grain.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then remove those bandages that you have wrapped between the patient's thighs and fold them between your right and left hand until they are dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to place the sponge in the wound so that it does not reach the bone and the other side of that.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	If you do not see it at the beginning of the wound, then place a small sponge in the wound until the bleeding stops; and then remove those that we have mentioned; and moisten cloths with warm water and apply them over the area and strengthen those sponges.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And remember that they sprinkle salt and place it in the cavity of the wound to prevent that which is left from that moisture.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And care for that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	If an abscess occurs in that location, then treat it with a poultice made of certain herbs until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of the methods of touching the wound.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the eyelids of wounds are not adjusted by their natural hairs and are antiquated, then touch those parts to the wound and make methods of maladies as with frequent tears and softening of the eyelids and cloth until that is the cause of destruction of the wound which is called tactinir of the wound, and cure it in four ways: either by cauterization with fire; or by acute medicine according to what is said in the chapter on cauterization; or by atactini at the beginning and suture; or by cannulas as I have said.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And so cover the head of the patient with a cloth; then convert the eyelid of the wound to your left hand, and if it is converted, it is good; and if not, insert the needle in the part that is farthest from the eyelid behind, and make the needle penetrate above, and that — close to the edge of the eyelid where there are no hairs — close to the hairs, and pull the thread above to the eyelid, and convert it to the right.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	Approach the part of the eyelid behind the eyelashes and insert a small blade into the lacrimal canal; then remove the pus and place it under the eyelid or on a piece of cloth, and hold the eyelid open with your thumb while applying pressure.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	However, one should pay attention to the shape according to the degree of elevation of the eyelid, which varies among men, and those who require a larger incision in the eyelid according to the amount by which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And approach the blade above the two lines that have been held, and begin from the larger lacrimal canal to the smaller one.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is near the natural eyelashes, it should be as large as possible.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And place the onion in one of the two angles of the eye socket, and remove all the cornea, and adjust the incision with two pieces of thin wool or gauze, and wipe away the pus, and let any excess drip onto two cotton balls.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And after three or four days, approach the stitches of the wounds and care for that.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you want, leave the stitches in place and care for that with a dry and constricting agent, because the eyelid should be sealed with the wound and its adhesion; but stitches are better. Therefore, I will now show you the ancient methods of taxanir.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But in his care for the patient, it is a good operation, and not in fear.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And there is another method in taxanir, and it is that you place a figure on the eyelid like a mirror, and then lift the eyelid three fingers apart and bring it together according to this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if it is not possible to do that, hold the fingers apart, and if it is not equal, take a needle with thread and place it in the middle of the figure, and insert the other end of the thread into the larger lacrimal canal, and the second end of the thread into the smaller lacrimal canal, and adjust the threads to be equal, and then raise your hand to the height that we have recommended.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust both sides of the wound with stitches, and cure that which is unwell.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	If a boil occurs on your skin or in your wound, cover that boil with wax and the same ointment, and apply it.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	Some wounds under the eyelid that are converted into eyebrows, then cover with what you used for the wound we mentioned earlier; but stitching is more artificial.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	To bandage the legs is as follows:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And you should fold the eyelid and cut the figure that is according to what I have mentioned; and then, by art, make two bands or thin strips of them, of which the length should be according to the length of the eyelid and the width of theirs should be less than the width of the space.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already incised at the ends of each part where you have the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then add each thread under that which superfluously hangs from the eyelid of the eye, and press the bands of each part very tightly, and leave it for several days until the skin around the band dies and becomes rejected and rots within a few days if it is not removed.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	If it is too late, then break the humor with lancets, and then cure the pain until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Therefore, when it is solidified, the eyelid is raised and the hairs do not prick.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the way to make cans that you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and have the quantity of length and width neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of raising the pricking hairs in the eyelid when the hair is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When they are unnatural hairs, hard, rough, and pricking the eyelids, then perform the operation in this way: you take a thin needle and place it on a soft and sharp cedar, and then adjust the ends of it and notches as subtly as possible.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And the length of the needles is the quantity of one palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you can make another thin needle from it in a short time, and use the ends of that if you want.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then place the patient's head on your shoulder, and position yourself close to the sunlight so that your work can be clearly seen, as this is a delicate and small operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then introduce the needle into the eyelid at the point that needs to be sewn, and make it penetrate quickly into the eyelash, removing any excess above the eyelid.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the eyelid up and insert that into the eyelash, and have one or two or three but not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand out and insert it into the eyelash, in the place where the eyelid is not sewn, to the eyelash naturally.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is not sewn, then insert it into the parts behind the eyelid that you have composed at that point, where it will stay sewn under the eyebrow.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And then place it against the eye, as you will sew it and the eyelid, and grind it and clean the eye, and leave the bandage for two or three days, until the eyelid adheres to its place and heals well.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the skin is too short, then adjust a longer piece of skin from the natural skins, and elevate it to that one, or let it lie flat until it has stretched out enough space, and then elevate it.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	About the cure of ehratism that occurs in the upper eyelid.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When it occurs in the outer part of the eye, and the contraction of the eyelid occurs when it is turned upwards, to the right or left side, due to poor consolidation of the skin or dryness or cauterization, and this ehratism is called leporine, and whether it is natural or accidental, it is caused by poor consolidation of the skin or dryness or cauterization, or by similar conditions.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	May the method of the operation in this be that you cut through that consolidation and separate the lips of it, and place it in that which is between those a cloth of linen, and tie them together when they have healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And do not use remedies that dry out the causes of which they dehydrate and constrict, because if you do so, it will return to being worse than at any other time without fire having been used.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in those of causes that soften, such as fenugreek, and apply the water in which they are boiled along with their seeds or yarrow oil, which should be liquefied by heating all the oils, and apply this mixture to the affected area, and cure it.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	The treasure of your remedy is that you perforate all the affected area that is not consolidated according to its original form at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	This operation, which we have mentioned, is only a correction of the consolidation that does not return the form of the area according to how it was originally.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure of consolidation that is made in the eyelid.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This consolidation that is made in the eyelid, which is not properly called consolidation; and it is of two kinds, one natural and another accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	Accidents are caused by pressure or by cuts or by burns or by similar means.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the method of operation for this is that you take a needle with which to make double thread, and place it in the flesh, and make it pass from the left lacrimal into the right lacrimal, until the thread reaches both ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	Then extend the flesh to the parts above the needle and hold it with the other hand, and cut away from the needle, and insert it into the wide gap.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And if the figure of the eyelid returns to its original shape, it is good; otherwise, take the razor and place it on the broken part, and convert that part of the eyelid, and make the two cuts on the side of the eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And make the ends of the two cuts at two angles of the incision, which you made when they converge, and make the other end of each cut at an angle so that when they meet, a figure is formed.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is written in Greek letters: alpha.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then remove the flesh from that part as much as it is thick after the pain, which is called the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the separated parts and bind them with wool thread; and then care for those with what we have said about softening medicines and poultices until they are healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if you have made an incision or suture or cauterization, then you should make the incision flat on the skin of the eyelid according to what is prescribed.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate the poultice between two lips as we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the sum of the sermon on the cure of incisions when they are raised or lowered, that it should run in the operation according to what is prepared in the form of incisions, and that is in the form of various shapes.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the skilled craftsman always prepares an instrument in each possible way that is possible to enter and make the figure return to its natural form, or close to that, and the patient according to what suits the operation and tools in the best arrangements.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adherence of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.

And then you insert the adhesion into a thin space, which should not be sharp to avoid discomfort for the patient and leave the space that does not descend to the eyelid and its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And your incision should be made with ease until the eyelid returns to its natural form and the entire adhesion is healed.
