E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And you should make these medicines into powder that is ground over the wound, such as they are dry; and generally, administer all of this medicine of property of which is that it removes and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And guard yourself second that the wound in your cure is not net; and it is not in the deafness of tongue or other; nor does it allow to aggravate in it; because when it is adjusted over the membrane of the brain, corrode that and poreys that, and happen upon the patient that malicious evil.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And happen upon the top of the head, as from there the bone is formed and more when it is deeply treated with that, and it becomes black on the surface of it; and therefore consider now if it happens to the patient those accidents that we have said, know that it is dangerous for all.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If there is no other illness except for the one that is placed above, and it is due to the effectiveness of that medicine that cures that illness, then cover that part with a piece of honey and four pieces of roasted garlic, and place a cloth over it; and then place it on the affected area and apply the appropriate treatment for healing until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	You should know that the nose is not broken into two pieces equally, but rather one of those parts is more rounded, or some of those parts have bones, while the other part is cartilaginous and does not break, only its shape, twist, and width change.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	If one of the two parts of the nose is broken, then cover it with a small piece of the same nose, and align that fracture with the other side, until it returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And this should be done by you for your own convenience, and beware that you do not cause harm to the patient during your operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the uppermost part of the nose, and it does not permit to see through it, then cover it with a small patch.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then do the same thing.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And if you can restore the patient on the first day after the fracture, do so; otherwise, then bring the seventh or tenth day to pause the dressing of the abscess.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And if the fracture is in one part, then insert a piece of cloth into the end of the nose, or if it is in two parts, then place two pieces of cotton, and make sure they fill up the entire opening of the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And tell the ancient healers that the cotton should be wrapped in a border, and moved around all day, but not seen by me; having covered the piece with alum mixed with powdered molasses, and then leave it until the bone is stopped and the cartilage is strengthened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And some bandages should be inserted into the nose, in place of a gag, unless it is wrapped in a cloth from the lion; and if you have already broken the fracture of the nose, more violently than the patient is prohibited from inspiring.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary for you; and if you want, do that, and if you want, make gags.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another bandage causes an abscess, apply the nose with a cerate or a poultice made of bread and honey, or with diachylon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	However, if no abscess is caused, then cover that deformed part with flour of sizami and powder of chalk mixed with egg white; and place a cloth from the lion on it, and do not let the nose touch anything.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	However, if the bones of the nose are fractured or crushed, then cover those with it, and extract those with instruments that are appropriate for them; and place this laceration, and heal that with what encases and consolidates, and with ointments that are suitable for it.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	If there is a bleeding nose, then apply pressure to stop it and insert a tube into the nostril to prevent further blood loss.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter 4.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jaw when it is dislocated.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jawbone is broken and the fracture does not cause pain, look to see if the fracture is only slightly deformed and not completely broken into two pieces, but curved to the parts inside, then it is likely that it will heal on its own.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is in the middle of the jaw, then introduce your finger from the left side into the patient's mouth; and similarly, if the fracture is on the right side of the jaw, then introduce your finger from the right side into the patient's mouth; and push against that softness of the fracture to facilitate the deformed parts, with your other hand on the opposite side of the bone; and hold it in place.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jawbone is already separated into two pieces, then apply traction to both parts in a straight line as much as possible to realign it.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is a disruption of teeth to the point of breaking, then use those materials that you hope will remain intact, such as gold or silver or cedar; and place them over the broken jaw, and place them over the doubled-up cloth, and place a large, properly made pad, or a single weight equal to the length of the jaw; and hang it above the second that you have prepared for the application, until it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to rest and be at ease, and place a lion's tongue decoction on their wounds.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you suspect that the figure has been altered in some way, then wait and remove it on the third day; and correct what has been altered from it and apply that mixed with powder of moli, album of egg, or flour of chickpeas, so that you have already removed the cement from it, and place a lion's skin over the application.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then, with this annex and adjusted, apply the ointment to it, and if the position of the bone has not been altered, leave it until it is healed and strong; for this fracture is usually healed in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another complication occurs, such as an abscess, then administer the same remedies we have mentioned for fever during the patient's recovery, and that abscess will also heal.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is severe, consider whether the bone has been separated or not, then carefully apply the appropriate remedy for removing those fragments from the wound.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the openings of the wound are narrow, then enlarge them using a probe according to your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you have removed those fragments and they do not remain, then enlarge the wound openings if necessary; otherwise, place one of the appropriate remedies on the wound and cover it until it heals.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the scapula when it is fractured.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	The scapula is broken at the part where it meets the shoulder blade, and this fracture occurs in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	When it is broken, or separated, or separated into two parts other than the shoulder joints; and it is more difficult to restore; or it is such that it has happened in the shoulder joints, and it is difficult to restore; or it is such that the fracture is in the arm.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that case, when the fracture is in the arm, is to have two assistants, so that one holds the injured arm and follows the broken furcula, and the other extends the neck to that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then align the fracture with the bones in front of it as it is made in the second form of the curve, and not in the prominence or concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if more extension is needed, then cover it with a cloth or wool from the patient's head above, and make its size according to your need; and extend and elevate the furcula and bind the cloth in your hand inside, so that the fracture is aligned as it should be.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	If you cannot pull the tip of the sternum to the fractured parts, so that it reaches the prone, then place the patient on their back, and place a large cushion over their chest muscle.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the assistant massages the chest muscle to the fractured parts before the bone of the sternum is raised to its position in the prone, and then you correct the fracture and equal it with those called ribs.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	However, if you feel any sharp pain from the sternum and its surrounding area, then do so over that and remove those sharp pains for ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is held in the bone, then use one of the scissors that you have prepared for this, since you have placed the forceps under the sternum; and this forceps is made of iron:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And its shape is similar to a hook, and its width is according to what you need from it, depending on the size of the bone or its fragility.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	May the length of it be second to what is possible for the operation; there should be two extremities with times, and one extremity should be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the wound that you have incised when you extracted the bone's tag is wide, and it is safe from pus, then adjust both sides of the wound with stitches.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is narrow, or you fear pus, then fill the wound with bandages and powders according to the amount of the wound's incision.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if pus does occur, then pour in a cloth with warm water and rose oil, and place it over that.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	May the structure of the bone when it is wounded and cut be that you place a poultice made of flour of mold and album of honey on it, and place it over the shoulder of the lion, and place your hand over the back of the wound, if necessary, and take humidify, which is twisted by the Saracens, that should be long enough, and its width should be one palm or about that; and place powdered duplicates on the poultice and the bandage; and place a thin tablecloth of the width of three fingers and lengthwise similarly; and wrap that in cloth, and place that cloth with the tablecloth over the location of the fracture; and take humidify as it revolves, and revolve it on the neck of the patient and behind the ear of the patient, and reduce it over all parts, and when the structure of the fracture is structured downwards, and that is what should not be hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And even if the bone above the broken leg is not displaced; and so that you can see the patient every day, when the bandage is softened or you remove the splint, then you should straighten it again and strengthen the ligament.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the patient's pillow on their shoulder, and place another pillow under their arm to support the patient's arm in the new position; so that the helper can raise the patient's arm from the side of the other, and thus elevate the fracture of the clavicle at the elevation of the muscle; or the arm of the patient is placed on the shoulder of the other.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not remove the bandage unless an abscess occurs in the wound within twelve days.

Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the restoration of a shoulder fracture.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	A splint is broken in the affected area and not the fracture itself, but the edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And when the affected area is broken - and it is broken in the middle of the affected area - and it is not known except by touch, then according to the figure of the fracture, prepare for the treatment of it and reduce it according to its natural form in any way possible.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And place your hand over the area with powdered egg white and lemon juice; and place a folded cloth on it; and place a thin sheet of tablecloth according to the amount of the splint or more.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	If the sheet is concave in any part of the splint, then level that concavity with lemon juice, and place the sheet according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And place a bandage over it with prolonged humidity and by the construction of a decent and firm hold of the sheet until it is not released from its own place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the ligament in each day; and all the time it is softened, apply another bandage and strengthen it and make it even if it remains in its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And place the patient on their left side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The spoon is restored in 10 days or in 25.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And when this number is completed, then you dissolve the bandage, and you know that it is from the bones of which the beginning was not feared or their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if the wound occurs in the bone of the foot and place it under the skin, then you cut it on it, and hold it, and do as we have said in the fracture of the furcula of sadacio of abscess caut if it happens here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the chest.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The chest is broken in some places of it and that ends up; but the extremities of it are somewhat attached and comminuted.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And when the patient's leg is broken, it bends at the fracture parts and causes great pain, difficulty in breathing, and cough, and much sweat and vomiting; and it is declared in the cavity of the broken bone and is not hidden from feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	The restoration of the broken bone is that the patient is placed on their back, and a cushion is placed between their shoulder blades; then press the muscles of the bone, and adjust the ribs of the bone to two vertical positions, and gradually perform the operation of the bone and its alignment according to all possible and appropriate methods until it returns to its original shape.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	Then place a poultice and bandage over the broken bone on a thin layer of salt or honey and similar substances on top of it, so that you can wrap it in cloth; then gradually apply the poultice to the fracture so that it is not too tight; and when the wound has softened, strengthen it with a proper bandage. Also consider the wound throughout the entire hour, and when it is softened, strengthen it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if the need arises to remove that part of the body that is affected by the disease or inflammation, pain, or abscess that has occurred in that area, then you should cut and remove that part and eradicate the plaster and correct what has happened due to that hand's healing method; and then return the plaster, if necessary, and adjust it within the structure until it is healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of the ribs when they are broken.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	You should know that the fracture of the ribs does not occur except in the broader parts where they are divided; and from the extremities of those parts, nothing happens to them except due to that which is cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And you should not be blinded by the feeling of it, but rather make an inquiry about it and the mentioned ones.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration should be as equal to the fracture as possible, within the structure, until it is covered and then apply plaster and strengthen the broken bone with that one, if necessary.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	If the rib fracture is directed towards the internal organs, the patient experiences severe pain and puncture, similar to the puncture experienced by those who have cried out, and for this reason the bones are covered with a bandage; and they experience difficulty in breathing, coughing, and vomiting, which is difficult to cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And the ancients used this method with great success.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And they said: cover the patient's abdomen with a cloth to generate inflation and ventilation, so that the abdomen is filled and extended, and the fracture is pushed away from the internal organs.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	We do not use this method to avoid causing an abscess, unless it occurs; and if it does occur, we now help with that.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And they said to them that it should be placed above the wound and squeezed with great force; and this is similar to reasoning, but it is feared that the wound will attract excess fluid to the area due to its weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And they say to the patient: cover that place with a wool that has already been submerged in hot cauterizing oil, and place powders between the ribs until it is filled, which should be the same amount as when you wrap the second time; and then cure the patient with the care of pleurisy from food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if the patient experiences severe constraint that they have not suffered before, and the bones puncture the bandage, then cover the patient with a blanket, revealing the broken rib, and place your hand over that instrument that contains the cipher, the memory of which is preceded, and cut the bone to facilitate its removal.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then adjust the loose lips of the wound, if it is large, with a bandage, and cure that with ointments until it is healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if an abscess occurs, then you cover it and insert powders in hot rose oil and place your hand over the area, and cure the patient with that which covers the abscess.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And let him lie on his left side while he is recovering.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of the fracture of the sacrum of the back and neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some fractures occur in the bones of the neck, and are similar to those in the sacrum of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when such an accident occurs to anyone and you want to know if it will heal or not, consider the following: if the bones are already softened and numb and dead and cannot move or strengthen those, and when you press them with your fingers or prick them with a needle and feel no pain in them, then you know that it is not healing, and in such cases the prognosis is mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if you feel pain in them when pressed or pricked, then you know that the neck of the bone is saved and that the patient will recover.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see the same thing in the sacrum of the neck and want to know if it will heal or not, then consider the feet of that person.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	When you see that it has already become softened, if those things happen in the muscles, and when it is on its back, it becomes paralyzed and cannot urinate, and some people lie on their back and want to urinate but cannot, then you know that it is fatal, and therefore do not treat it.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	If none of those things happen, the cause is better and less dangerous.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	The treatment of it is to prick the abscess with a needle that you place on the spine, or with a thorn dipped in honey or garlic; place some of those on the abscess to help sedation.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And then place one of the plasters that provide comfort and relief, and strengthen it with a bandage; command the patient to use rest and tranquility and not to sleep on the side where the pain occurs until it is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if there is an infection of the bone or some cause that has already been separated from it, then cover it with a bandage and splint that bone; and then adjust the wounds of the plague, with stitches if it is large; and then care for that with some flesh of the meat, until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	If the back of the thigh bone is broken, and it is at the end of the spine, then you should insert your left hand into the anus, and equalize the broken bone with the other hand as much as possible; and if necessary, apply pressure and splinting, and then strengthen that.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	If you feel broken ribs in the chest, then cover that area, and hold it, and treat the wound with the cure that is preceded by healing until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De restauracio de la ancha.	Of the restoration of the ankle.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the ankles are broken, and if they are broken, the fracture of them is only communication in the extremities of those and they are inserted in the length and decline to the parts intended; and the patient experiences pain at the location and puncture, and the blanket is shocked when the fracture occurs.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of it is that you extend your hand over that which is above the fracture, which is the figure of it.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is only at the end of it, then you should equalize it with the second one that you have prepared for equality, entering as much as necessary until it is restored to its natural figure.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the long bone or that already declines to the parts below, then you should make the patient lie on their back until they are prepared for the restoration of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And when you have equalized that one, place your hand on the plaster, and place another hand on that star of wood or of coda, and strengthen for stricture over the one you do not fear puncture of fracture or removal of the star.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And equalize the concavity of that which places that one inside of which that one takes the stricture according to equality, and command the patient to lie on their back or on their side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if abscess occurs, then you should cease from extension of it and its restoration until that which is sedated the abscess, and place your hand on that one which precedes that; and then return to the restoration of it, and strengthen that which has cover.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if there are fractures or dislocations in the bones, then treat them accordingly.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the fracture of the humerus.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The humerus is that which is between the ribs and the shoulder joint.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, then the restoration of it is in one of two ways, one of which is that you hold it with your hand in this manner:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	and if it is attached to two ends of bands, then suspend it from the elevated place.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And follow the patient on a chair; and when you reach the broken arm over the thigh, it should reach the elbow of the same place where the curvature of the bone is attached.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And then suspend something heavy over that, or the nurse extends it to the parts below; and the doctor should put the fracture back together again as soon as possible until the fracture returns to its place.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other assistant should make sure that the patient is lying on their back and holding their head with their hand; and then command two assistants to hold what is above the fracture with their hands, and the other should hold the broken part of the body; and each of them should extend their part.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then press on the fracture with your hand and on the other hand with the other hand, and each of the two assistants should extend their parts.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And if the fracture is near the end of the muscle, then place half of the cloth on the side of the body and the other behind the fracture to protect it.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly, if the fracture is near the body, then place the cloth on that spot and on that part.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Equalize it with that and its work, and when it is equaled according to what is covered and applied properly, then press on that if it does not cause an abscess.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	If an abscess occurs, leave the stricture in place until the seventh day, and place a wet bandage on the sore in advance of the wound, and apply rose oil until it is ready to be reopened, and then strengthen it.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	The method of strengthening it is to place a plaster on the fracture, and then cover it with a clean cloth; and then adjust the arm on the assistant, and place your hand on the affected muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And then cover the cloth and strengthen the arm on the assistant's shoulder to prevent the arm from being in a sling, if there is no cause for the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use slings.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And then place a sling over the fracture that is higher and stronger than the others; and between each sling, let the length of the sling be according to the fracture, added by three digits of the whole part.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then strengthen the slings with the stricture that I mentioned at the beginning of this chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And your structure over the area of the fracture should be straighter.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And as the fracture becomes more curved, the structure becomes smaller.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And if you see the position of the ribs and the structure as we have said in the time when you restore the member to its original position, then do so.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear infection, then leave the structure and ribs inside as we have said on day seven.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the bandage in all parts for three days to prevent it from occurring in the wrong place or inflammation; or it is prohibited for food to arrive at the member due to the arrangement of excessive structure; and therefore correct everything as we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are unsure about any cause of this, then do not remove the bandage for three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And the patient's head should be on their back, and their hands should be over their stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place your hand on the assistant's full of wool equally, and consider at all hours of the night or day that the figure of the broken member is not separated or dissolved, or that the bandage is softened, therefore correct everything according to your skill.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	Pause the food of the patient according to the order we have given, unless the food is delicate at the beginning until it is digested; and afterwards cover that food with a cloth.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	It is customary for the assistant and the nurse of the patient to be strong for ten days; and afterwards cover that food with a cloth and bathe it and medicate it with the remedies that correct that one.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is not healed after one or two months, then you should not remove that bandage and those splints.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Of the restoration of a broken arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones, which are called two knuckles; one is small and is the one that is closest to the wrist, and the other is large and is the one that is placed behind the small one from the wrist.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And if the larger or smaller knuckle is broken alone, or both are broken at once, it is very painful.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	When the small intestine is cut above, its repair is more difficult, and its healing is even more difficult.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	When the large intestine below the fracture of the patient is bad, and its healing is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And it is even worse when two bones are broken.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore, if the bone that is broken is the small intestine above, it is advisable for the doctor to facilitate its repair by gently extending it.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	But if the large intestine is that which is broken, then one should apply more forceful extension.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both intestines are broken, then one should apply the most forceful extension.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And one should apply the figure of the hand to the repair and extension of the intestine over a cushion, and place the patient's hand above, and the ear should be lower than the others, and the patient should be lying on a pillow.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And place a cushion underneath their head or arm, to prevent the patient from moving.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	Then approach the assistant and extend their arm on the side away from their body or arm, and another assistant should do the same on the other side.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	And approach the doctor to set the bone as best as possible according to its figure.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if there are nails in the bone fracture, then drill through them all to remove them from their place according to your skill.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if the nail appears to be separate and not according to your hope for its restoration, then do as we mentioned above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	But if the fracture is in a difficult place, and you have already treated that chapter, then take care of that cure.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if an abscess occurs at the beginning of your treatment, then you should apply a cloth made of olive oil and white wax, and be careful not to press too hard or too lightly, and strengthen the cloth over that thin structure until the abscess gives way; and then remove the cloth and apply a prepared paste of powdered myrrh and honey, and place a strong bandage over that fracture.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And you know that the number of ribs in the arm is always in the major positions, or if there is a fracture in one or two places.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	Then place your bandage on the location of the fracture as tightly and forcefully as possible, and when more strength is needed to apply the bandage above or below the fracture, place it more gently than previously mentioned in the beginning of this chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	The cloths that are wrapped around the fracture should be soft and not hard or sharp, and the best one is the one that is strong enough to move between subtle and rough, as we have recommended.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	And consider the member and the limb close to the fracture.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if there is any cause for which correction is necessary, such as the one that has already occurred to the member, and then you should make sure that you bring the member with a straight tail before that problem stops.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And do not force the member until it is ready, and then return the bandage.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the contraction has already been softened and the bone has regained its shape and similar to those, then with your skill, rectify all of that.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	And if the nourishment is prohibited from reaching the member due to excessive stricture, then gently loosen that one a little and let it rest for several days until the nourishment can reach it, and then strengthen it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	However, if the patient does not experience any of those causes that we have mentioned, then do not let it slip within approximately 20 days or around those times.

De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	Of the restoration of bone fractures when they are broken.

But if extension is not to your preparation and the equality of it with your other hand, then reduce it with this instrument; and this instrument is made of iron, the length of which is seven or eight fingers, and the width of which is according to the size of the wound; and for this reason, it is necessary for the doctor who uses these three or four according to the amount needed in the cure in all cases of fracture.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And it should be straight, and it should be in the correct position during surgery to avoid bending the instrument over the other.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And it should have a sharp tip that is marged in the other's sharp parts; and its underside should be broad and its top should go into the parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	This is the shape of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is called "volentz atelarem" in Greek, which is its name.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	Because the end of it should be placed on the tip of the prominent bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And push that into a groove inside which the bone returns, and it should be equal to some balance.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And then force you to equal the ends of the fracture between them, and if the end of it broken is thin, and you do not take that with the instrument for good reason, then you should insert the end of that bone into where the instrument has power over that.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone to all of that which we have recommended, then insert that which is necessary for it from the scissors that we have said; or saw that which is a tooth in some way that is possible to you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And then remove those that are in the bones of the spine and small scraps.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bones are reduced, and the reduction causes the patient great pain, you will know that the bones have not returned to their natural position; and therefore do this so that you greatly benefit the patient.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When your restoration of the bones is complete, and then submerge it in a strong sterile black cloth, especially if it is in summer, and do not place it on any wound or other cause in which there is oil, so that it does not cause further damage and corruption.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And then administer stitches at the time of your completion of the restoration of the bone, and leave the wound exposed until it is closed with forceps and bandages according to the size of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And be very careful not to strain the wound on the fracture, because such actions have been done by many doctors, and they cause damage to their patients, which is harmful.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	If the neck structure is loose, soft, and different from the structure of other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	If the wound is large or bad, and you fear that the evil accidents we have mentioned might occur, and there is great pain in that place, then do not place your hand over it, but make that envelope of hard cloths in place of sticks and strong pressure on those.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when the wound begins to close after one or two days, then remove the cloth that you placed over it, and administer poultices, using those that are of our custom to heal wounds, such as tetrapharmacon and similar to that.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is convenient for you to remove the bandage and consider the wound on each day at midday and evening until it is consolidated and closed, and cover that member in such a way that the poyredura flows from it to the parts behind it to facilitate healing.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If many days pass and the wound is not consolidated or does not close on its own, then know that this is a sign of smallpox for which you should inquire about the wound and examine it carefully.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And from those stains, remove those that are separated and extracted, those that are not separated and put the member and cause acute pain, pierce those that are possible for you to do.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if the wound becomes infected or putrefied, it is often due to another kind of corruption and putrefaction, then place on it one of those remedies that are suitable for it from the cure which is preceded by narration in its own chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And of that in which you should place your finger: when the large ones are cut, raise it over the member that is there with the bones of the cushion and the helper and similar to those of the great members, and do not assume attraction of it, nor its extraction, because many evils can occur by that which causes death; having left that inside for twenty days or thirty; and then cure the wound if you see fit, and if not, leave it.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Of the cure of a node that occurs at the site of some fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Nodules occur at the site of healing from fracture, and more frequently near the joints, and is caused by the shape of the limb; and it often prevents the member from performing its natural operation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider whether the node is recent and administers in those medicines that have stopped bleeding such as aloes, and enses, and mirabilis, and serpentaria, and acrasia, and similar to those; taking some or all of them, and confirming them with astringent, or album of honey, or astringent tincture, and place that over the node in a cloth, and bind it well over the node.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And if that stricture does not allow it to pass for several days; then remove it and apply another, until the node is reduced; or strengthen it on that plaster of descentment, which has the property of reducing everything that is inflamed in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If the joint has become petrified and is causing constant pain, and it is necessary to separate it from that part of the body where it is most deeply embedded, and then incise the excess and eminent, or remove it with a sharp instrument before it becomes fully detached; and cure it within the time when it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	When a fracture is restored and the limb becomes thin and fragile, it does not return to its original nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a fracture of the bone is restored, and the limb becomes thin and fragile, it is not done for many reasons: one of which is the lack of solution of the ligament and the cord of that part, made not according to its nature; or because of excessive strictness of the ligaments before the nutrient can reach the limb; or because of excessive embrocation; or because of superfluous movement not in its proper time; or because of weakness in the body of the patient and because of his debility.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And the treatment for that is to give the patient garlic to eat and make them drink the juice of it until their heart becomes stronger; and administer baths; and insert gauze and lettuce on it.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And place a poultice on the limb, so that the poultice attracts nourishment to it, or continues to relieve the inflammation of the affected area until the nourishment comes and returns to its natural shape.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Of the treatment of broken bones that have been restored incorrectly and prevented surgery on them because of this.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When an injury occurs to the limb that has already been restored, immediately remove the incorrectness of the bone and the swelling, and shape it like the limb, but if the limb is not prohibited from its natural operation, then do not accept the word of anyone who exists and says that the limb is newly broken.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But if it has already been done by foolish doctors and restorers who have done this in our land, and this operation is very reprehensible because it causes great fear of the death which is fatal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	If the stiffness and swelling are recent, then it is customary to apply a poultice made of water with softening herbs such as althea leaves and rue, mellolot, and similar ones; or make an ointment with diallaquelon well prepared; or use a mucilage of rue root mixed with honey or oil of camphor, and apply it to that; or use soft fatty figures trampled with the palm of your hand, and similar to those of the medicines that are named emmanagogues.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And some remedies are dissolved in an excessive amount of the lightest oil, which is the most humid, and administered to move the limb at all parts in all hours.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	If the twisting has already passed and is strong and converted into stone and requires treatment with iron, then it is customary to remove the pus under the skin and dissolve the continuity of the bone, and scrape off that which exceeds the swelling of the affected part with a fine saw, and administer facilitation in that with solicitude and study.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of speech in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the disruption of one of its joints, which prevents movement, and distorts the shape of the limb, causing severe pain and injuries on the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when dislocation occurs, it is best to reduce it as soon as possible, and not delay the reduction, because if it is delayed, the limb becomes infected and it becomes difficult to reduce the dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And to avoid this, it is not recommended to move or stretch the limb during infection, because movements and pain can cause muscle cramps.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	When that happens, it is recommended to cover the patient's abdomen with a cloth, and wait until the abscess stops; then apply heat and oil to the limb, and reduce it as soon as possible.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And the limb should be treated with the oil that will bring memory back to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have already ordered the capital letters of dislocation according to what is preceded in fracture; from the part of the shoulder enter into the part that is placed behind.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter twenty-four.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of the cure of jaw dislocation.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	If the lower jaws are dislocated and do not articulate; and the dislocation of them is made in one of two ways: either they are repositioned from their places by a small removal, and are slightly molded; or they are dislocated entirely and completed, before they are molded at the part of the joint where the saliva of the patient flows out and which cannot hold that nor close his mouth, and the tongue of him is covered in his palate.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	When the dislocation of it is small, then return it to its place in the greatest positions by itself.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	When the dislocation is entire and completed, then cover it so that reduction of it is administered gradually, and not delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the minister should hold the patient's head, and the doctor should insert their fingers into the mouth, one at a time, on the edge of the dislocation of the jaw, inside the mouth, if the dislocation is on one side; or that they insert both fingers simultaneously, if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other two fingers on the cheeks, and equalize them; and command the patient to stop their jaws and remove those from each part; and the doctor should equalize the jaw and push it back into place before it returns to its original position.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	If the reduction is difficult, especially if both jaws are frequently dislocated, then administer evaporated water and oil, until a light reduction is made and do not delay the reduction of both jaws, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And then, when they are equalized and the patient's mouth is closed and not molded, then place some woolen cloths on those parts, and make a paste of cera and oil, to facilitate the movement of the jaws.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And the patient's head should be between two pillows, so that it does not move to the front or left; and do not force any cause; having the same view, open his mouth with a spoon, when the pains are relieved and his jaw is unlocked, then open that which you want.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And that should be administered with ease, and do not force the opening of the mouth for food and drink and defecation, until the jaw is unlocked and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if it is difficult to reduce two dislocated jaws at any time and they are not converted to their normal positions, then use heat and constant soda, and frequently apply a warm cloth to the patient's abdomen, and frequently vomit with pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see that, know that it is fatal; and those who experience that die within a few days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the sternum and the extremity of the muscle.
